thread.title: Local athletes in college: Oct. 13, 2015 - Local Athletes in College
thread.title_full: Local athletes in college: Oct. 13, 2015 - Local Athletes in College - NorthJersey.com

author: JOHN ROWE
title: Local athletes in college: Oct. 13, 2015 - Local Athletes in College
text:
Jabrill Peppers, Paramus Catholic
This is the type of game Jabrill Peppers signed up for: No. 7 Michigan State at No. 12 Michigan in the Big House on Saturday.
The former Paramus Catholic star warmed up for the biggest game of his young collegiate career with a performance that earned him Co-Big Ten Conference Freshman of the Week honors.
The redshirt freshman safety had five tackles and 1 1/2 tackles for loss in Michigan’s shutout win over previously undefeated Northwestern on Saturday. He added a game-high three pass breakups as the Wolverines held Northwestern to 130 passing yards.
Michigan has compiled three consecutive shutouts (BYU, Maryland, Northwestern) for the first time since 1980, and has outscored its opponents, 154-7, in the last 20 quarters.
The Wolverines are first in the nation in scoring defense (6.3 points), first in third-down percentage defense (18.8), second in total defense (181.3 yards per game) to Boston College, second in passing defense (115.5) and third in run defense (65.8). Yet Peppers, who also returns punts, thinks Michigan can be even better.
"There’s still room for improvement," said Peppers. "We come in time in, time out with a great game plan. It’s up to us to execute. We have a lot of talented guys who take pride in what they do."
Damian Corredor, Weehawken; Jonathan Schmitt, Cliffside Park; Matt Williams, East Rutherford
* Damian Corredor, a junior from Weehawken, Jonathan Schmitt, a senior from Cliffside Park, and Matt Williams, a sophomore from East Rutherford and Becton excelled in Kean’s 35-10 win over Christopher Newport. Corredor rushed for 172 yards on 21 carries, Schmitt, a tight end, caught eight passes for 157 yards and Williams, a linebacker, had a game-high nine tackles.
Keith Rodman, Old Tappan
* Keith Rodman, a sophomore from Old Tappan, rushed 20 times for 121 yards and a touchdown Saturday for Springfield College in a 35-13 win over Hobart — which was ranked No. 22 by D3football.com.
James McNerney, Northvale
* James McNerney, a sophomore center from Northvale who played at St. Joseph, anchors the offensive line for Assumption College (5-1). The Greyhounds, who are in first place in the Northeast-10, have the top-ranked running offense in the conference.
Lauren Malajian, Haworth; Justine Larocca, River Vale
* Lauren Malajian, a junior from Haworth, scored a goal, assisted by Justine Larocca of River Vale, as 10th-ranked The College of New Jersey routed New Jersey City, 9-0, in women’s soccer.
Mollie Kearns, Wanaque
* Mollie Kearns, a senior midfielder from Wanaque and Lakeland Regional, contributed a goal as William Paterson beat Misericordia in women’s field hockey. 
Sam Browne, West Milford
* Sam Browne, a senior forward from West Milford, scored two goals and added an assist in Rowan’s 5-1 victory over Ramapo College in field hockey.
Brittany LaBruna, Bloomingdale
* Brittany LaBruna of William Paterson, a junior from Bloomingdale, won the Flight A singles title at the tennis tournament held by the New Jersey Association for Intercollegiate Athletics for Women. She also teamed with Summer Bernales for a runner-up finish in Flight A doubles.
